text: George Douglas Sanders (July 24, 1933 â€“ April 12, 2020) was an American professional golfer. He won 20 events on the PGA Tour and had four runner-up finishes at major championships. He was born in Cedartown, Georgia. He was a member of the U.S. Ryder Cup team in 1967, which won in Houston. Sanders died in Houston on April 12, 2020 from dementia-related problems, at the age of 86. ==References== Category:1933 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from dementia Category:American golfers Category:Sportspeople from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Sportspeople from Houston
title: Doug Sanders
